metadata.title: CVE-2015-9253 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in PHP 7.3.x before 7.3.0alpha3, 7.2.x before7.2.8, and before 7.1.20. The php-fpm master process restarts a childprocess in an endless loop when using program execution functions (e.g.,passthru, exec, shell_exec, or system) with a non-blocking STDIN stream,causing this master process to consume 100% of the CPU, and consume diskspace with a large volume of error logs, as demonstrated by an attack by acustomer of a shared-hosting facility.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-9253` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-php7.0 - 7.0.33-0ubuntu0.16.04.16+esm3
libphp7.0-embed - 7.0.33-0ubuntu0.16.04.16+esm3
php7.0 - 7.0.33-0ubuntu0.16.04.16+esm3

criterions.comment: php7.0 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.0.33-0ubuntu0.16.04.16+esm3').
